import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from xgboost import XGBClassifier

def load_data():
    train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
    test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
    return train, test

def feature_engineering(df):
    # Title from name
    df['Title'] = df['Name'].str.extract(' ([A-Za-z]+)\.', expand=False)
    # Consolidate rare titles
    title_map = {
        'Mlle':'Miss','Ms':'Miss','Mme':'Mrs','Lady':'Royal','Countess':'Royal','Dona':'Royal',
        'Sir':'Royal','Jonkheer':'Royal','Capt':'Officer','Col':'Officer','Major':'Officer','Dr':'Officer','Rev':'Officer'
    }
    df['Title'] = df['Title'].replace(title_map)
    # Family size features
    df['FamilySize'] = df['SibSp'] + df['Parch'] + 1
    df['IsAlone'] = (df['FamilySize']==1).astype(int)
    # Cabin prefix
    df['CabinPrefix'] = df['Cabin'].str[0]
    # Ticket prefix (first char of ticket string, numeric tickets become 'X')
    df['TicketPrefix'] = df['Ticket'].str.replace('[./]', '').str.strip().str[0].apply(lambda x: x if x.isalpha() else 'X')
    # Fare per person
    df['FarePerPerson'] = df['Fare']/(df['FamilySize'])
    # Log fares
    df['Fare'] = df['Fare'].replace(0, np.nan)
    df['Fare_log1p'] = np.log1p(df['Fare'])
    # Drop original high-cardinality columns
    df.drop(['Name','Ticket','Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)
    return df

def preprocess(train, test):
    full = pd.concat([train.drop('Survived', axis=1), test], sort=False, ignore_index=True)
    full = feature_engineering(full)

    # Handle missing values
    for col in ['Age','Fare','FarePerPerson','Fare_log1p']:
        full[col].fillna(full[col].median(), inplace=True)
    full['Embarked'].fillna(full['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)
    full['CabinPrefix'].fillna('U', inplace=True)

    numeric_features = full.select_dtypes(include=['
